title.narrative: Minor repairing and upgrading of WASH facilities for 20 Schools in west Mosul neighborhoods with supply of education materials and stationary.

description.narrative:
The project includes quick rehabilitation / minor repairs, upgrading of WASH facilities for 20 schools in west Mosul neighborhoods, Al-Mansour, Telalroman, Al-Shuhadaa, Al-Maamoon, Al-Izdihar, Nablus and Al-Rehman neighborhoods with supply of education materials and stationary. This project will provide sustainability to the education life of 15380 pupils (8124 boy, 7256 girl) from stayees, returnees and IDPs families in west Mosul neighborhoods through providing upgraded level of education spaces and healthy environment to resume their education in such crowded schools. These neighborhoods were selected because the majority of families living here are vulnerable and highly populated. These quarters were also among the first one to be re-taken, and consequently ISIL fought strongly which caused a lot of damage to the buildings there, including schools.
The targeted schools include schools for boys, girls and other double shift schools in the six neighborhoods. They are also selected to include primary and secondary schools for both boys amp girls. The project can be implemented within a period of 3 months and include a gender mainstreaming component, demonstrate better cost-effectiveness and proposed period of implementation represents the best use of resources at that time. The beneficiary students are boys and girls including disabled students in addition to women and men from vulnerable families. The project includes contribution of stationary by EADE organization to all targeted schools. The project is covering the first-line response by provide critical emergency assistance to critically at-risk populations, extremely vulnerable individuals.
EADE is a specialized engineering organization with staff of significant previous experience in the field of construction and building rehabilitation and have unique skills to finalize such projects.
The project spending is: 86% of budget for the education activities (62% rehabilitation amp 24% education material supplies). 14% of budget for the WASH activities.
